alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Burlington, east central Montgomery, southeastern Bucks and northeastern Philadelphia Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm over Rockledge, or near Philadelphia. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported pea size hail in Northeast Philadelphia. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Bensalem, Riverside, Palmyra, Hatboro, Jenkintown, Beverly, Rockledge, Abington, Langhorne, Bryn Athyn, Ivyland, Wissinoming, Feasterville-Trevose, Willow Grove, Northeast Philadelphia, Feasterville, Tacony, Andalusia and Holmesburg. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 341 and 357. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 26 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
